conversation.text: Whisk two cups mayonnaise and a cup of buttermilk until it's smooth
evidence: Whisk together two cups mayonnaise and one cup buttermilk until smooth.

conversation.text: Can I use a fork instead of a whisk?
Yes, you can use any appropriate utensil to mix the two ingredients
Great, now what should I do next?
Next you're going to add spices to the mix
evidence: Toss in your spices, adjusting to your personal taste.

conversation.text: Ooh, what kind of spices and how much?

I'd recommend 3/4 Teaspoon each of salt, onion salt, and dried parsley 1/4 Teaspoon garlic salt 1/8 Teaspoon each of pepper, dill weed, and thyme. But, you can add more or less if you like or dislike a particular ingredient.
evidence: 3/4 Teaspoon each of salt, onion salt, and dried parsley 1/4 Teaspoon garlic salt 1/8 Teaspoon each of pepper, dill weed, and thyme

conversation.text: Great, should I mix it a lot or very briefly?
That's the next step
What should the mixture look like in my bowl?
Make sure it's homogeneous. How did you decide to whip up the mixture?
evidence: Whip up the mixture to your desired consistency, making sure that the spices are well distributed throughout the dressing. You can also mix the whole dressing in a seal-able jar, then shake to evenly mix up the dressing.

conversation.text: I just used the spoon I used to mix the mayonnaise and buttermilk with
Would you like to transfer the mixture into a jar and mix it that way?
evidence: You can also mix the whole dressing in a seal-able jar, then shake to evenly mix up the dressing.

conversation.text: Sure, I'll give it a try. What should the mix look like?
It's up to you if you like a thinner sauce mix it more but if you'd like a thicker sauce you can mix a bit less
Amazing, now what comes next?
Now, you've got to put the mixture in the fridge
evidence: Refrigerate for 2-3 hours before serving for the best flavor.

conversation.text: Oh, for how long?
Ideally 2-3 hours for best flavour but you can serve immediately.
How long will it last in my fridge?
It should last a week but it really depends. Are you going to eat all of it before it goes off?
evidence: This dressing will last about a week in the fridge

conversation.text: *laugh* indeed I doubt it'll have the chance to go off before I ear it all
Remember to keep the mix in the fridge whenever you're not eating it
evidence: It should be kept cold whenever it is not being eaten.

conversation.text: yes, i will do that. Do I have to cover the bowl with the mixture?
That would be optional. Do you have anything that can serve as a cover?
I have plastic film, would that suffice?
Yes that is perfectly okay
Great amazing thanks for your help
Congratulations! You have successfully completed this cooking task.
Thanks for running me through the recipe and my questions

procedure.summary: Whisk together two cups mayonnaise and one cup buttermilk until smooth.
procedure.description: This is the creamy base of your dressing. If you don't feel like using mayonnaise, you can also use 2 cups plain, whole-fat yogurt instead, leading to a slightly healthier ranch dressing. For a "best of both worlds," use half sour cream and half plain yogurt. Make sure you shake the buttermilk well before adding it. If you don't have any buttermilk, whole milk will work as well. You can add the juice from 1/2 a lemon to get the sour, buttermilk taste without the buttermilk.

procedure.summary: Toss in your spices, adjusting to your personal taste.
procedure.description:
The blend of flavors and spices you add are up to you, but the basics are usually pretty standard across the board. You can't go wrong with:
3/4 Teaspoon each of salt, onion salt, and dried parsley
1/4 Teaspoon garlic salt
1/8 Teaspoon each of pepper, dill weed, and thyme

Whip up the mixture to your desired consistency, making sure that the spices are well distributed throughout the dressing. You can also mix the whole dressing in a seal-able jar, then shake to evenly mix up the dressing.

procedure.summary: Refrigerate for 2-3 hours before serving for the best flavor.
procedure.description: You can serve the ranch immediately if you want, but it will always be better if you give the flavors time to mix and blend. This dressing will last about a week in the fridge. It should be kept cold whenever it is not being eaten.
